channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16101] Procedure v2 - Perf Tool for WAL
item.description:
Add upstream tools to measure procedure perf
There are 2 main thing to measure:

  • Procedure Loading
  • Procedure Writing
item.summary: Procedure v2 - Perf Tool for WAL

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Hey Matteo Bertozzi, i have uploaded first version with single tool.

master.10 patch has microbenchmarking tools for wal writing and wal loading.
will add the tool for proc executor next and put up in addendum patch.
opening another jira for proc executor perf tool since it's easier to track.

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HBASE-16534
correction: executor --> proc scheduler

Matteo Bertozzi Appy guys please ping me before commits to 1.3.0, as I'm stabilizing branch now, as I posted here - http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/hbase-dev/201608.mbox/%3CCAHxLZBUVM7L9Bfi8xhVs7PYZLB%3DN5qxefY9zhTqEZovk5StvLg%40mail.gmail.com%3E

Let's also target such jiras to 1.3.1 now.

Sorry about that Mikhail Antonov, you can blame me.
Em, when are you planning to fork to the branch? I think it'll be easier for you and anyone committing patches.

Appy No worries, just please ping me in the future.

Well, branch-1.3 in git has been there for a while, and I'd like to start considering it as a release branch in terms of stability (e.g. I believe a failed Jenkins run not obviously related to ASF environment issues on release branch should be considered a high priority issue) and approach to commits. I'm testing some RC builds locally now and should start rolling official RCs this/next week.

Let's aim to target new large features to 1.4 to start with, and (non-blocking) bugfixes to 1.3.1.
So basically yeah, I should figure out RCs work in next few days, would appreciate if everyone holds off commits to branch-1.3 until then..
